page.title: 02Nature North of Llanfihangel
page.content: An area of small farms rearing mainly sheep on enclosed rough grazing, many fields have been enlarged and fenced rather than hedged. There is scrub, spinneys & hedgerows for wildlife but most is found in the in the mixed deciduous & coniferous woodlands on the slopes to the river Rheidol, a salmon river. The woodlands & its margins are rich flora & fauna particularly & wide varieties of bird life. The gravel pits and river attracts water birds and the Cormorant & the Heron are regular visitors. There is a strip of rough heath type land on the south bank of the river with gorse & scrub which produce another habitat. On the rougher more open land " grazing " birds such as Lapwings and Fieldfares are common. There are also Kestrels, Red Kites & Buzzards nesting & feeding locally.
